intro: Hieracium solutum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium solutum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
